title: Taylor's Theorem
description: A smooth function can be approximated by its Taylor polynomial, with explicit remainder terms (Lagrange and Cauchy forms).

meta.author: Taylor, Lagrange (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Named after Brook Taylor (1715), though known earlier to James Gregory (1671). Lagrange developed the remainder term in 1797. Fundamental to numerical analysis.
overview.proofStrategy: Uses repeated application of the Mean Value Theorem and careful analysis of the error term.
keyInsights: The Taylor polynomial gives the best local approximation

conclusion.summary: Taylor's theorem is verified with both Lagrange and Cauchy remainder forms.
